isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Rocker Arm Supports, Push Rods, and Valve Bridges

svcproc.title: Rocker Arm Supports, Push Rods, and Valve Bridges

step1.para:
Apply lithium grease
to valve stem tips and to valve bridge pockets.
Place each of the previously marked valve bridges on their respective valve stems.

figure.caption: Push rod assemblies and rocker arm support (typical)

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, keep cam followers and push rods in the order removed and install in original order.
To prevent engine damage, seat push rods in the hydraulic roller follower sockets.

step1.para: Apply clean engine oil to end of each push rod and install to original locations with the copper finish end on top.

note.para: Rotate crankshaft and observe the intake push rod at number 3 cylinder. Cylinder number 1 is in firing position when intake push rod at cylinder number 3 indicates cam lift, and the crankshaft damper dowel pin is at the 10:30 position.

step1.para: Position crankshaft so that cylinder number 1 is at Top Dead Center (TDC) and in firing position.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make sure push rods have seated in the rocker arm pocket.

step1.para: Install dual fulcrum plate assemblies for cylinder numbers 1, 2, 7, and 8.
Install and tighten M10 x 70 bolts for cylinder numbers 1, 2, 7, and 8 as follows:

item.para: Make sure that pivot foot is centered on valve bridge.
Tighten inboard (upper) bolts to 61 N·m (45 lbf·ft).
Tighten outboard (lower) bolts to 61 N·m (45 lbf·ft).
Make sure that pivot foot is centered on valve bridge. If pivot foot is not centered on valve bridge, remove and reinstall dual fulcrum plate assembly in question.

note.para: Rotate crankshaft and observe the intake push rod at number 8 cylinder. Cylinder number 4 is in firing position when intake push rod at cylinder number 8 indicates cam lift, and the crankshaft damper dowel pin is at the 10:30 position.

step1.para: Rotate crankshaft 360° (full turn) so that cylinder number 4 is in firing position.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make sure push rods have seated in the rocker arm pocket.

step1.para: Install dual fulcrum plate assemblies for cylinder numbers 3, 4, 5, and 6.
Install and tighten M10 x 70 bolts for cylinder numbers 3, 4, 5, and 6 as follows:

item.para: Make sure that pivot foot is centered on valve bridge.
Tighten inboard (upper) bolts to 61 N·m (45 lbf·ft).
Tighten outboard (lower) bolts to 61 N·m (45 lbf·ft).
Make sure that pivot foot is centered on valve bridge. If pivot foot is not centered on valve bridge, remove and reinstall dual fulcrum plate assembly in question.
